com.smartnsoft.droid4me
Interface LifeCycle

All Known Subinterfaces:
SmartableActivity<AggregateClass>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSmartListActivity, AbstractWrappedSmartListActivity, Droid4mizer, ForBusinessObjectActivity, SimpleWrappedListView, SmartActivity, SmartGroupActivity, SmartListActivity, SmartMapActivity, SmartPreferenceActivity, SmartSplashScreenActivity, SmartTabActivity, WrappedListView, WrappedSmartListActivity
public interface LifeCycle

Identifies a typical work-flow for an activity of the framework.

The methods are sorted in chronological order of call by the framework.

Since:
2008.05.18
Author:
Édouard Mercier

Nested Class Summary
static interface LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy
          Indicates the way (synchronously or asynchronously) the business objects should be retrieved.
static class LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException
          This exception should be triggered on the framework methods which allow to throw it, when a business object is not accessible.
 
Method Summary
 void onBusinessObjectsRetrieved()
          This is the typical callback that will be invoked when the business objects have been actually retrieved.
 void onFulfillDisplayObjects()
          This is the place where the derived class can initialize the previously retrieved graphical objects.
 void onRetrieveBusinessObjects()
          This is the place where to load the business objects.
 void onRetrieveDisplayObjects()
          This is the place where the derived class can get all graphical objects and put them into attributes.
 void onSynchronizeDisplayObjects()
          Will be invoked during the Activity.onResume() execution, every time.
 void refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean retrieveBusinessObjects, java.lang.Runnable onOver, boolean immediately)
          Asks the implementing Activity to reload its business objects and to synchronize its display.
 

Method Detail

onRetrieveDisplayObjects

void onRetrieveDisplayObjects()
This is the place where the derived class can get all graphical objects and put them into attributes. The method is invoked during the Activity.onCreate(android.os.Bundle) execution, after the parent Activity.onCreate(android.os.Bundle) method has been invoked.

It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

onRetrieveBusinessObjects

void onRetrieveBusinessObjects()
                               throws LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException
This is the place where to load the business objects. It is strongly adviced not to modify the GUI during this method execution.

It is NOT ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

Throws:
LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException

onBusinessObjectsRetrieved

void onBusinessObjectsRetrieved()
This is the typical callback that will be invoked when the business objects have been actually retrieved. It is strongly adviced not to modify the GUI during this method execution.

It is NOT ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread! If the Activity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, this method will be invoked from a high-priority worker thread.

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

onFulfillDisplayObjects

void onFulfillDisplayObjects()
This is the place where the derived class can initialize the previously retrieved graphical objects. The method is invoked during the Activity.onResume() execution, and only the very first time.

It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

onSynchronizeDisplayObjects

void onSynchronizeDisplayObjects()
Will be invoked during the Activity.onResume() execution, every time. It is supposed to fulfill the display objects that may need some refreshing due to the underlying business objects that have changed.

It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay

void refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean retrieveBusinessObjects,
                                      java.lang.Runnable onOver,
                                      boolean immediately)
Asks the implementing Activity to reload its business objects and to synchronize its display. The method invokes the onRetrieveBusinessObjects() and onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() methods.

Must be invoked only from the UI thread, when the SmartActivity is synchronous!

Parameters:
retrieveBusinessObjects - indicates whether the onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method should be invoked or not
onOver - if not null, this method will be eventually invoked from the UI thread
immediately - if this flag is set to true, even if the implementing Activity is not currently displayed, the execution will be run at once. If set to false, the execution will be delayed until the Activity.onRestart() method is invoked
